revised_title: Gas Voltaic Battery: Experiments and Applications
tldr: The author, W.R. Grove, conducted experiments with a gas voltaic battery using oxygen and hydrogen gases. They discovered that the battery generated electricity through chemical synthesis at the points where the liquid, gas, and platinum met. Grove also tested Faraday's law of definite electrolysis and discussed different forms of the gas voltaic battery, comparing their advantages and disadvantages. This research contributed to the understanding of gaseous voltaic action and the development of modern batteries.
